content.question: A particle moves along the x-axis with velocity given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac> <mrow> <mn>10</mn><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>0.4</mn><msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbiqaaq6bqaaaaa aaaaWdbiaadAhadaqadaWdaeaapeGaamiDaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiab g2da9maalaaapaqaa8qacaaIXaGaaGimaiGacohacaGGPbGaaiOBam aabmaapaqaa8qacaaIWaGaaiOlaiaaisdacaWG0bWdamaaCaaaleqa baWdbiaaikdaaaaakiaawIcacaGLPaaaa8aabaWdbiaadshapaWaaW baaSqabeaapeGaaGOmaaaakiabgkHiTiaadshacqGHRaWkcaaIZaaa aaaa@4B6E@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> for time 0 ≤ t ≤ 3.5. The particle is at position x = -5 at time t = 0. (a) Find the acceleration of the particle at time t = 3.

frqParts.text: A particle moves along the x-axis with velocity given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac> <mrow> <mn>10</mn><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>0.4</mn><msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbiqaaq6bqaaaaa aaaaWdbiaadAhadaqadaWdaeaapeGaamiDaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiab g2da9maalaaapaqaa8qacaaIXaGaaGimaiGacohacaGGPbGaaiOBam aabmaapaqaa8qacaaIWaGaaiOlaiaaisdacaWG0bWdamaaCaaaleqa baWdbiaaikdaaaaakiaawIcacaGLPaaaa8aabaWdbiaadshapaWaaW baaSqabeaapeGaaGOmaaaakiabgkHiTiaadshacqGHRaWkcaaIZaaa aaaa@4B6E@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> for time 0 ≤ t ≤ 3.5. The particle is at position x = -5 at time t = 0. (a) Find the acceleration of the particle at time t = 3.
(b) Find the position of the particle at time t = 3.

(c) Evaluate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>3.5</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4185@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and evaluate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>3.5</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>|</mo> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mo>|</mo> </mrow> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44A7@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Interpret the meaning of each integral in the context of the problem.

(d) A second particle moves along the x-axis with position given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FBB@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>3.5</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DED@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. At what time t are the two particles moving with the same velocity?

topic.text: 2.7: Derivatives of cos x, sin x, ex, and ln x

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
